required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Investigate the Effect of MCE on Glucose and Insulin Responses in Healthy Males
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Cross-over Study, to Investigate the Effect of Mazie Cob Extract on Post-prandial Glucose and Insulin Responses in Healthy Males

brief_summary.textblock: Maize Cob Extract (MCE) is intended to be used as a bulking agent in food. The purpose of this study is to determine the glycaemic and insulinemic response of MCE consumed in isolation compared to glucose; the glycaemic and insulinemic response will also be determined for MCE alone and in combination with glucose. This is a randomised, double-blind, single-centre trial in 10 healthy male participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in venous glucose from incremental area under the curve (iAUC) (T-15 to T120 minutes)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through intervention periods of two hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in venous insulin from incremental area under the curve (iAUC) (T-15 to T120 minutes)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through intervention periods of two hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximal concentrations for glucose and insulin (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through intervention periods of two hours
